isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (with R-134a Refrigerant System) - DESCRIPTION OF SYSTEM COMPONENTS - BLOWER SPEED CONTROL RESISTORS

svcproc.title: BLOWER SPEED CONTROL RESISTORS
svcproc.para: The blower speed control resistors consist of a resistor network located in the blower motor circuit. By connecting to different points in the network, the blower speed control can change the resistance in the blower motor circuit, providing multiple blower speeds. The resistor assembly is usually located in the blower air stream to prevent overheating.
The blower resistors influence blower speed as follows:

item.para: Blower speed is decreased by increasing resistance in the blower motor circuit.
Blower speed is increased by reducing resistance in the blower motor circuit.

svcproc.para: During high speed operation, a relay routes current from a 30 amp fuse directly to the blower motor, bypassing the speed control resistors. For more detailed information, refer to GROUP 8 ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS in the Master Service Manual.
